question_details.title: Will the US State Department's Diversity Visa page still be online on March 31, 2025?
question_details.resolution_criteria: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Step 1 Submit an Entry page with instructions for registerning for the Diversity Immigrant Visa (DV) Program is at [this location](https://travel.state.gov/content/travel/en/us-visas/immigrate/diversity-visa-program-entry/diversity-visa-submit-entry1.html) when attempted to be accessed by Metaculus on or after April 1, 2025.

news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**H-1B visa registrations open soon: Top 25 firms that sponsor immigrants**
The H-1B visa registration for 2026 opens on March 7, 2025, and closes on March 24, 2025. The US Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) issues 85,000 H-1B visas annually, including 20,000 for advanced degree holders from US institutions. The top 25 firms that sponsor H-1B visas in 2024 are: Amazon (9,265 approvals), Infosys (8,140 approvals), Cognizant (6,321 approvals), Google (5,364 approvals), Tata Consultancy Services (5,274 approvals), Meta (4,844 approvals), Microsoft (4,725 approvals), Apple (3,873 approvals), HCL Technologies (2,953 approvals), IBM (2,906 approvals), and others. Indian professionals receive the majority of H-1B visas each year, accounting for 72.3% of all H-1B visas issued between October 2022 and September 2023. Dhriti Prasanna Mahanta, Vice-President, TeamLease Degree Apprenticeship, said, 'India's vast and diverse workforce is primed to meet global industry needs in technology, engineering, and IT.' 
Original language: en
Publish date: March 05, 2025 05:10 AM
Source:[Business Standard](https://www.business-standard.com/finance/personal-finance/h-1b-visa-registrations-open-soon-top-25-firms-that-sponsor-immigrants-125030500291_1.html)

**Canada Extends Temporary Protection Status for Ukrainians**
The Canadian government has extended the temporary protection status for Ukrainians who arrived in the country under the CUAET program by March 31, 2024. To maintain this status, applicants must submit their application by March 31, 2026. According to the Government of Canada, 'These temporary measures will allow Ukrainians and their family members to continue working and studying in Canada during this difficult time, and ultimately return home when it is safe. Access to free settlement services for all Ukrainian temporary residents and their family members in Canada is available until March 31, 2025. We continue to assess how our immigration programs can best support people affected by the war in Ukraine,' - reads the government's website. Canadian Immigration Minister Mark Miller announced on February 27, 2025, that Ukrainians and their family members who entered Canada through the CUAET program by March 31, 2024, will have the right to submit an application to extend their status by March 31, 2026. 'Canada remains committed to supporting the people of Ukraine and their families as the war continues, ensuring their safety. That's why, through this expansion, we aim to offer protection, recognizing the long-term goal for many to return home safely and properly. We continue to support Ukraine and its people,' - quotes the department Mark Miller's words. 'Canada remains committed to supporting the people of Ukraine and their families as the war continues,' said Mark Miller. The Canada-Ukraine authorization for emergency travel (CUAET) is one of the special measures taken by the Canadian government to support the people of Ukraine. The program provides Ukrainians and their family members with extended temporary resident status, allowing them to work, study, and stay in Canada until they can safely return home. To date, nearly 300,000 people have used this initiative to move to Canada. Participants in the program receive temporary financial assistance and housing support. It is very important that all CUAET participants submit their applications for status extension before the expiration of their work or study permits. All CUAET visa applicants must meet visa and tourist requirements; undergo a standard biographical data check (including biometric data) and a control check. Individuals who submit their applications within the established timeframe will be allowed to maintain their current work or study status pending a decision on their application. Each case will be evaluated on an individual basis.'
Original language: uk
Publish date: March 04, 2025 09:29 PM
Source:[newsyou.info](https://newsyou.info/2025/03/novij-status-dlya-ukra%D1%97nskix-bizhenciv-u-kanadi-yaki-umovi-slid-vikonati)

**UK Opens Online Registration for Electronic Travel Authorization**
The United Kingdom will open the online registration for the Electronic Travel Authorization (ETA) on Wednesday, March 5. The ETA will be mandatory for travelers to the UK starting April 2, 2025. According to the UK Embassy in Spain, the ETA is a similar system to those used by other countries, such as the US and Australia, to improve border security. UK Ambassador to Spain, Alex Ellis, stated, 'It's a simple process that aims to improve security management.' Ellis also emphasized that the UK 'is delighted to continue receiving travelers from Spain,' who 'make a significant contribution to the country.' The registration process will cost 10 pounds (approximately 12 euros) and will be valid for two years. It can be done online through the UK government's website or through the UK ETA app. Travelers who will be exempt from registration include those in transit, those with approved visas, and residents of the UK or Irish citizens.
Original language: es
Publish date: March 04, 2025 04:12 PM
Source:[LaSexta](https://www.lasexta.com/viajestic/consejos-viajeros/reino-unido-abre-registro-online-viajar-pais-que-sera-obligatorio-abril_2025030467c71a6b829a0900019ac850.html)

**Kazakhstan Introduces Online Service for Changing Identification Documents**
The Kazakh Ministry of Internal Affairs, in collaboration with the Ministry of Digital Development, Innovation and Aerospace Industry, has developed a pilot project allowing citizens to change their identification documents online. According to the project, citizens can apply for the service if their identification document is due to expire within 30 days or has already expired within the last 10 days. The application must be filled out by the citizen themselves on the eGov portal or mobile app. The pilot project will run until March 31, 2026, and is currently open for public discussion on the 'Open NPA' portal until March 19, 2025.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 04, 2025 11:22 AM
Source:[otyrar.kz](https://otyrar.kz/2025/03/kazahstanczy-smogut-menyat-udostoverenie-v-onlajn-formate/)

**Kazakhstan to Launch Online Passport and Identity Document Issuance**
The government of Kazakhstan plans to launch a pilot project to issue passports and identity documents online. According to the document, the project aims to provide an alternative to the current process. The project will allow citizens to exchange their expired passports and identity documents through the electronic government portal and mobile apps. The developers have proposed an algorithm for the pilot project, which includes documentation through the portal and mobile apps for citizens who need to exchange or replace their documents without a decision or administrative protocol. If the service is not available through the portal and mobile apps, the user will be notified to visit a CTO. The applicant must fill out the application themselves based on the documents specified in the Rules of Providing State Services. After forming the registration ticket, the application will be sent to the UMS DP of the corresponding region for verification. The employee of the UMS DP will check the application for correctness and accuracy, as well as the photo and signature, and, having certified it with an electronic digital signature, will send the application to the central node of the RPD DRN for document production. If the application is canceled due to a poor-quality photo or signature, the user can submit a new application, re-paying the state fee. The previously paid state fee will be returned to the user in accordance with the Tax Code of the RK. The result of the provision of the state service will be issued by the employee of the territorial subdivision of the migration service in the corresponding registration point on the basis of the registration ticket number of the application. The document was developed to improve the process and increase the efficiency of providing state services, as well as to organize the work on improving the quality of service to the population on issues of issuing passports and identity documents to citizens of the RK. The pilot project is planned to be implemented by March 31, 2026. The project is posted on the 'Open NPA' portal for public discussion until March 19, 2025.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 04, 2025 03:58 AM
Source:[Zakon.kz](https://www.zakon.kz/pravo/6469142-kazakhstantsy-smogut--menyat-udostoverenie-lichnosti-v-onlainformate.html)

**Kazakhstan to Introduce Online Service for Replacing Expired Identity Documents**
The Ministry of Internal Affairs and the Migration Committee of the Republic of Kazakhstan have prepared a decree to introduce an online service for replacing expired identity documents and passports. According to inbusiness.kz, the project aims to translate the service of replacing identity documents due to expiration into an online format. The project's goal is to provide an alternative to the current process. As stated in the document, 'We aim to approve the algorithm for implementing the pilot project, as well as an addition to the specification of requirements for the software for issuing passports, identity documents in the online format through the electronic government portal and mobile applications for population documentation due to the expiration of the identity document.' The pilot project will run until March 31, 2026. 
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 04, 2025 03:50 AM
Source:[inbusiness.kz](https://inbusiness.kz/ru/last/dva-glavnyh-dokumenta-kazahstancy-smogut-pomenyat-onlajn)

**Policy Week in Review - February 2025 #3 | JD Supra**
The Senate Health, Education, Labor and Pensions (HELP) Committee has approved the nomination of Lori Chavez-DeRemer as Labor Secretary by a vote of 14-9. Her nomination will now move to the Senate floor for a final vote. Meanwhile, the U.S. Department of Labor has appointed Randy Johnson as Administrative Review Board Chair. Bipartisan immigration legislation, H.R. 1589, has been reintroduced. Littler's Inclusion, Equity and Diversity C-Suite Survey Report 2025 highlights the challenges faced by companies in balancing the rapidly shifting political landscape with employee expectations and existing IE&D commitments. International Women's Day's campaign theme, 'Accelerate Action,' emphasizes the need for progress towards full gender parity, with the World Economic Forum predicting it will take until 2158 to reach this goal. Additionally, 17 states have revived their legal challenge to PWFA regulations, and there have been updates to eligibility for interview waiver applications at U.S. consulates, which may impact nonimmigrant visa holders. Pay transparency laws are becoming more prevalent worldwide, with employees increasingly sharing their compensation details online.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 03, 2025 12:00 AM
Source:[jdsupra.com](https://www.jdsupra.com/legalnews/policy-week-in-review-february-2025-3-8234881/)

**US Department of State Releases March 2025 Visa Bulletin**
The US Department of State has released the March 2025 Visa Bulletin, outlining per-country priority date cutoffs for immigrant visa availability. The USCIS will use the Final Action Dates chart for employment-based (EB) filings in March 2025. The chart shows slight advancement for EB-2 applicants from all nations, EB-3 applicants from China and India, and Other Workers applicants from all nations except China. The EB-1 cutoff date for All Chargeability Areas, Mexico, and the Philippines remains current, while the EB-2 cutoff date for All Chargeability Areas, Mexico, and the Philippines advances six weeks to May 15, 2023. The EB-3 cutoff date for All Chargeability Areas, Mexico, and the Philippines remains December 1, 2022. The USCIS will use the Final Action Dates chart in March 2025, likely in response to high visa demand throughout the first half of the fiscal year.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 28, 2025 06:30 PM
Source:[JD Supra](https://www.jdsupra.com/legalnews/us-department-of-state-releases-march-3197041/)

**How To Apply For Green Card In 2025: Check Eligibility, Application Process, Important Dates | All You Need To Know**
The US Department of State's Bureau of Consular Affairs recently released its Visa Bulletin for January 2025, providing crucial updates for green card applicants. The bulletin highlights significant progress for both family-sponsored and employment-based (EB) visa categories, particularly benefiting Indian applicants. Key updates include the EB-2 India priority date moving from April 22, 2012, to October 15, 2012, and the EB-3 category moving from December 1 to December 15, 2012. US Green Card eligibility depends on family ties, employment, refugee status, or diversity programs. Applicants can check their case status on the USCIS website and update their address if they move to avoid delays.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 23, 2025 06:46 AM
Source:[Jagran English](https://english.jagran.com/world/how-to-apply-for-green-card-in-2025-check-eligibility-application-process-important-dates-all-you-need-to-know-10220137)

**March 2025 Visa Bulletin Updates**
The U.S. Department of State (DOS) released the March 2025 Visa Bulletin, which outlines the availability of immigrant numbers for employment-based preference cases. The bulletin shows movement in various categories, including EB-2, where Mexico, Philippines, and All Chargeability categories advance six weeks to May 15, 2023, and EB-2 India jumps six weeks to Dec. 1, 2012. EB-3 China advances one month to Aug. 1, 2020, and India advances six weeks to Feb. 1, 2013. In contrast, the EB-4 category retrogressed by 17 months to Aug. 1, 2019. USCIS announced that for March 2025, it will only accept adjustment of status applications based on the final action dates chart for all employment-based preference categories.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 18, 2025 03:54 PM
Source:[mondaq.com](https://www.mondaq.com/unitedstates/work-visas/1585760/march-2025-visa-bulletin-updates)

**Green Card: The Diversity Visa Program Offers a Simplified Path to Permanent Residence**
The Diversity Visa Program, also known as the 'visa lottery', is a simplified way to obtain a green card without the need for a labor or family sponsor. This program offers up to 55,000 visas annually to individuals from countries with low migration rates to the US. The goal is to promote cultural diversity in the country and give citizens of underrepresented nations the opportunity to obtain permanent residence. Unlike other immigration processes, the visa lottery does not require a labor or family sponsor. The selected individuals can apply for permanent residence after completing a verification process and meeting the established requirements. To be eligible, applicants must meet the following requirements: 'have a high school education or its equivalent, or have at least two years of work experience within the past five years in an occupation that requires at least two years of training or experience.' It is essential to note that applicants must meet both requirements (education and work experience) to be considered eligible. The registration process for the visa lottery is free and online through the official website of the Department of State. The results of the visa lottery are published on the Department of State's website, usually between May and July of the following year after registration. Applicants must log in with their confirmation number to check if they were selected. It is crucial to note that the government agency does not send notifications by email, phone, or postal mail. Therefore, applicants must be attentive to the publication dates and check their status online. The Diversity Visa Program represents an accessible option for obtaining a green card without the need for sponsorship. With clear requirements and a structured process, it provides the possibility of permanent residence. To increase the chances of success, it is essential to meet all the criteria, submit the application within the established deadlines, and follow carefully each stage of the process. Staying informed through official channels ensures a proper participation and avoids potential scams or errors in the processing.
Original language: es
Publish date: February 15, 2025 01:19 PM
Source:[La Nacion](https://www.lanacion.com.ar/estados-unidos/visas-y-tramites/green-card-la-via-para-obtener-la-residencia-permanente-sin-tantos-requisitos-y-sin-patrocinador-nid15022025/)

**March 2025 Visa Bulletin - Some Cracks in the Ice**
The US Department of State has published the March Visa Bulletin, which shows modest improvements in all regions and most categories. According to the bulletin, if your priority date is earlier than the cutoff date listed in the bulletin for your nationality and category, a visa number is available for you that month. This means you can submit your DS-260 immigrant visa application or your I-485 adjustment of status application. The bulletin notes that USCIS will accept I-485 applications in March based on Final Action Dates, not the more favorable Dates for Filing chart. This is a change from previous months, where priority dates froze in February.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 13, 2025 08:51 PM
Source:[The National Law Review - A Free To Use Nationwide Database of Legal Publications](https://natlawreview.com/article/march-2025-visa-bulletin-some-cracks-ice)

**US Visa Bulletin March 2025: Key Green Card Updates for Indians**
The U.S. Department of State has released the Visa Bulletin for March 2025, which includes updates to Final Action Dates for employment-based green card categories. The EB-2 and EB-3 categories for Indian nationals have advanced by six weeks, with the Final Action Date shifting from October 15, 2012, to December 1, 2012, and from December 15, 2012, to February 1, 2013, respectively. The U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) will accept adjustment of status applications from individuals whose priority dates precede the Final Action Dates listed in the March 2025 bulletin. However, the EB-4 category has been retrogressed by approximately 18 months to August 1, 2019, and may become unavailable in the near future due to high demand. The monthly Visa Bulletin is essential for individuals navigating the U.S. green card process, providing two key sets of dates: Filing Dates and Final Action Dates.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 13, 2025 06:57 AM
Source:[bizzbuzz.news](https://www.bizzbuzz.news/international/us-visa-bulletin-march-2025-key-green-card-updates-for-indians-1351996)

**March 2025 US Visa Bulletin: Good News for Indians in Employment-Based Visa Categories**
The US Department of State has released the March 2025 visa bulletin, which shows improvements in the employment-based visa categories for Indians. The final action dates for EB-2 and EB-3 categories have moved forward by six weeks for Indians. The final action date for EB-2 category is now December 1, 2012, and for EB-3 category is now February 1, 2013. The EB-4 category has been stagnant for almost a year and a half, with a final action date of August 1, 2019. The US Department of State has warned that this category may become 'unavailable' in the coming months. The EB-1 category remains unchanged, with a final action date of February 1, 2022. The EB-5 category also remains unchanged, with a final action date of February 1, 2022. The family-sponsored visa categories for Indians remain unchanged, with no movement in the final action dates. The employment-based first preference (EB-1) category remains unchanged, with a final action date of February 1, 2022. The second preference (EB-2) category has moved forward, with a final action date of December 1, 2012. The third preference (EB-3) category has also moved forward, with a final action date of February 1, 2013. The other workers category has also moved forward, with a final action date of February 1, 2013. The fourth preference (EB-4) category remains unchanged, with a final action date of August 1, 2019. The fifth unreserved category (C5, T5, I5, R5) remains unchanged, with a final action date of February 1, 2022. The US Department of State releases a visa bulletin every month, which shows the progress of the green card process. This bulletin helps to estimate the time it will take for an applicant to receive their green card, based on the current backlog and the speed at which it is moving forward.
Original language: hi
Publish date: February 12, 2025 04:11 PM
Source:[Navbharat Times](https://navbharattimes.indiatimes.com/world/america/us-visa-bulletin-for-march-2025-brings-good-news-know-how-far-indians-have-progressed-in-green-card-queue/articleshow/118183074.cms)

**US Announces March 2025 Immigrant Visa Bulletin: Family-Based Categories Remain Unchanged**
The US Department of State announced the March 2025 immigrant visa bulletin, which shows that family-based immigration categories remain unchanged. In contrast, some employment-based immigration categories have made progress. According to the bulletin, Chinese-born individuals in the first preference category remain unchanged, while those in the second preference category advance by 16 days, and those in the third preference category advance by 31 days. Non-Chinese born individuals in the second preference category advance by 44 days, while those in the third preference category remain unchanged. Chinese-born individuals in the third preference category for non-skilled workers remain unchanged, while non-Chinese born individuals advance by 55 days. Chinese-born and non-Chinese born individuals in the fourth preference category both retrogress by 519 days. The US Department of State stated that 'the priority dates for the family-based categories remain unchanged, while some employment-based categories have made progress.' 
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 12, 2025 07:01 AM
Source:[UDN](https://udn.com/news/story/121777/8542893)

**USCIS Announces H-1B Visa Lottery Dates and Process for 2026 Fiscal Year**
The US Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) has announced the dates and process for the H-1B visa lottery for the 2026 fiscal year. The initial registration period will begin at noon on March 7 and end at noon on March 24, 2025. Employers and their representatives must register each beneficiary electronically through a USCIS online account and pay a fee of $215 per registration. USCIS has implemented several improvements to online accounts, including the ability for lawyers to work with multiple legal representatives, pre-loading certain fields on the I-129 form, and the ability to upload H-1B beneficiary data through a spreadsheet. The selection process for the 2026 H-1B visa limit will focus on the beneficiary, similar to the 2025 process. If enough registrations are received, beneficiaries will be selected randomly and notifications will be sent through USCIS online accounts before March 31. The Treasury Department has approved a temporary increase in the daily credit card transaction limit to $99,999.99 for the 2026 H-1B visa season. Transactions over $99,999.99 can be made through the Automated Clearing House (ACH).
Original language: es
Publish date: February 07, 2025 11:00 AM
Source:[eluniversal.com.mx](https://www.viveusa.mx/educacion/loteria-de-visas-de-trabajo-h-1b-estados-unidos-dice-cuando-y-como-hacer-el-registro-en-linea/)

**United States Opens Green Card Lottery 2026: How to Apply for the American Visa**
The United States has opened the Green Card Lottery 2026, allowing beneficiaries to reside permanently in the US and eventually apply for US citizenship. The program aims to promote diversity among immigrants, favoring individuals from countries with low migration rates to the US. To participate, applicants must meet the following criteria: The registration period for the DV-2026 program was open from October 2 to November 5, 2024. Although this period has ended, it is useful to know the process for future applications: The results of the lottery for the DV-2026 program will be available from May 3, 2025. Participants can check if they were selected by entering their confirmation number on the official website. If selected, they must complete the DS-260 online form and attend an interview at the corresponding US embassy or consulate. During the interview, their eligibility will be evaluated, and they will be informed about the next steps to obtain the immigrant visa. For detailed and updated information, visit the official website of the US Department of State.
Original language: es
Publish date: February 04, 2025 01:06 PM
Source:[El Español](https://www.elespanol.com/usa/20250204/unidos-abre-loteria-green-cards-puedes-solicitar-visa-americana/921658090_0.html)

**United States opens the Green Card Lottery 2026: This is how you can apply for the American visa**
The United States has opened the Green Card Lottery 2026, allowing beneficiaries to permanently reside in the country and eventually apply for US citizenship. The program promotes diversity among immigrants, favoring individuals from countries with low migration rates. To participate, applicants must meet specific criteria, including a registration process that took place from October 2 to November 5, 2024. The lottery results will be available on May 3, 2025, and selected participants must complete Form DS-260 online and attend an interview at a US embassy or consulate. As stated by the U.S. Department of State, 'For detailed and updated information, visit the official website.' 
Original language: en
Publish date: February 04, 2025 01:06 PM
Source:[El Español](https://www.elespanol.com/usa/en/20250204/unidos-abre-loteria-green-cards-puedes-solicitar-visa-americana/921658090_0.html)

**US Diversity Visa Program 2026: How to Check Your Results and Next Steps**
The US Department of State will not send a notification to applicants if they are selected for the Diversity Visa Program, so each person must check their application status. The program, which offers up to 55,000 visas to people from countries with low immigration rates to the US, has closed its 2026 registration and winners are waiting for the results, which will be published soon. To participate, applicants must meet certain requirements, such as being from a country with low immigration rates and having a certain level of education and work experience. The results of the lottery will be available online from May 3, 2025 to September 30, 2026. If selected, applicants must complete the DS-260 form, which is the immigrant visa application form, and follow the instructions provided. However, being selected does not automatically guarantee a green card, and applicants must meet additional requirements before being approved for permanent residence. These requirements include providing certain documents and attending an interview at the US embassy or consulate. If approved, the next step will be the issuance of the visa and authorization to enter the US as a permanent resident.
Original language: es
Publish date: February 01, 2025 04:21 AM
Source:[La Nacion](https://www.lanacion.com.ar/estados-unidos/visas-y-tramites/resultados-de-la-loteria-de-visas-de-eeuu-2026-las-fechas-y-que-sigue-en-el-tramite-de-residencia-nid01022025/)

**Diversity Visa Lottery 2026 Results: How to Check and Next Steps**
The Diversity Visa Lottery 2026 results will be announced in May 2025. Participants can check their results by visiting the official website dvprogram.state.gov/ESC, using their confirmation number provided during registration. The US government will not send emails or notifications to winners, so online verification is the only reliable method. If selected, the first step is to complete the DS-260 form, which is the immigrant visa application. After submitting the form, winners will receive a consular interview appointment at the US embassy or consulate. The interview will assess whether the applicant meets all the requirements for a visa, and if approved, they will proceed with the next steps to obtain permanent residence. Note that not all countries are eligible to participate in the Diversity Visa Lottery due to high immigration rates to the US, aiming to ensure diversity among immigrants.
Original language: es
Publish date: January 30, 2025 01:00 AM
Source:[LaRepublica.pe](https://larepublica.pe/estados-unidos/2025/01/29/resultados-de-la-loteria-de-visas-2026-esta-es-la-fecha-en-la-que-podras-saber-si-fuiste-el-afortunado-ganador-y-viajar-a-estados-unidos-lrtmusv-1870790)

**U.S. Department of State Closes Registration for Diversity Visa Lottery 2026**
The U.S. Department of State has closed the registration period for the Diversity Visa Lottery 2026, a program that offers a unique opportunity to obtain permanent residence. With up to 55,000 visas available, this initiative, created by the Immigration Act of 1990, aims to diversify immigration to the country by benefiting citizens of nations with low migration rates to the United States. The registration was open from October 2 to November 7, 2024, and was completely free. The results of the selection process will be available in May 2025, marking the beginning of the procedures for those lucky enough to be selected. According to the Department of State, the selection process is completely random and automated, and the results will be accessible only on the official program website: dvprogram.state.gov. To check if you were selected, you will need the confirmation number you received at the time of registration. It is essential to note that selected individuals will not receive emails or phone calls to notify them. Any communication outside of the official website may be an attempt to scam. The Department of State has warned about possible scams and recommends that participants only verify their status on the official page to avoid falling prey to deceit. The period for checking the results will remain open until the end of September 2026. However, it is advised to act quickly once confirmed, as visas are allocated until the annual limit is reached or the fiscal year ends. Being selected in the lottery does not automatically guarantee the issuance of a Green Card. Selected individuals must complete a series of additional steps to formalize their permanent residence. According to the program, the main actions they must take include: 'The Department of State has established clear criteria for granting permanent residence. During the consular interview, applicants must demonstrate that they meet the following conditions: ' The final decision to grant a Green Card rests with consular officials, who will meticulously evaluate the documentation and the applicant's responses during the interview.
Original language: es
Publish date: January 29, 2025 12:15 AM
Source:[LaRepublica.pe](https://larepublica.pe/estados-unidos/2025/01/28/el-departamento-de-estado-de-estados-unidos-finalizo-el-proceso-de-seleccion-de-55000-visas-descubre-si-fuiste-elegido-y-como-obtener-la-green-card-lrtmus-493556)

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: Historically, the Diversity Visa (DV) program has faced political challenges and scrutiny, particularly during certain administrations. Despite this, the program has managed to persist through various political climates as it is legislatively established and changes to it require significant political effort and alignment. Given that the page's existence is closely tied to the legislative status of the DV program, the historical continuity of this page remaining online has been strong. Thus, I would estimate that the base rate probability of the site being up, considering past political challenges not resulting in its removal, is approximately 80%.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Legislative Stability
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The DV program's existence is mandated by law, requiring congressional action to abolish or substantially alter it. This legal backing makes it resilient to unilateral executive actions. Thus, the legislative stability marginally increases the likelihood of the page remaining online.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Technological Continuity
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: From a systems architecture perspective, government web pages are usually stable and experience less frequent changes. The technological continuity and institutional inertia in maintaining existing web pages further support the continued operability of the site.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Political Factors
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: While political factors can impact program perception and call for reforms, the practical removal of online resources would require significant political consensus and effort. The current political environment does not indicate such consensus focused directly at the DV page removal.
